creator: neon.leon@netzero.com

comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60.0
Build ID: 20180503143129

Steps to reproduce:

Restarted browser several times with same issue.
Tried other videos, found same issue
Tired older videos that worked fine in past, but now fail to play properly in ver 60.0
Tried watching Youtube channel in different browser with no issues!
Monitored CPU and I/O using Process Explorer and I do NOT see high CPU or Bandwith issues.


Actual results:

YouTube videos I watch will constantly freeze video but the audio continues to play.  This occurs when watching them in full screen mode as well as the small in browser mode.  I can play the exact same videos just fine in Chrome so bandwidth is not the issue.  
I even re-played older videos that i had watched that worked fine earlier, but now with FF ver 60 they freeze up.
I have provided a link to the youtube channel where I experience the issues.  
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwpHKudUkP5tNgmMdexB3ow


Expected results:

I expect videos to play without frozen images.
comments.author: neon.leon@netzero.com

comments.text:
I miss-read the "Steps to reproduce" as for how I proved I can reproduce it.

To reproduce, simply play a video from the youtube channel that referenced. 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwpHKudUkP5tNgmMdexB3ow

As a follow up, i have now tried many other youtube channels and it appears that the channel i reference above is prevalent in freezing up, while others play fine.  I can't find the difference between that channel and the others such as  Sci show 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dsxsa1qnaAU
or Seeker https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XhFhK97hrdY&t=42s
which seem to play fine.
comments.author: neon.leon@netzero.com

comments.text:
Please enter about:support into the address bar. Click the "Copy text to clipboard" button, paste into Notepad, then after saving the file click the "Attach File" link above comment 0 to upload it.

(In reply to Leon from comment #0)
> older videos that worked fine in past, but now fail to play properly in ver 60.0

Do you mean they used to work in Firefox 60, or they used to work in a previous version of Firefox? If it's the latter, it would be helpful if you could find the regression range.
https://mozilla.github.io/mozregression/quickstart.html
comments.author: gingerbread_man@live.com

comments.text: Also: right-click or ctrl-click on the video and select "Stats for Nerds", watch it, and if possible take a screenshot during or immediately after a pause/stutter.  Attaching the contents of right/ctrl-click Debug Info may also be useful.  Thanks
comments.author: mreavy@mozilla.com

comments.text:
I also get this issue. The video will seemingly randomly (though more often towards the beginning of the playback) freeze. The audio will keep going during that time. After a while the video unfreezes, and the image jumps to whatever the time is now and plays as if nothing happened.
I encounter this fairly randomly on various channels.

During that I tried clicking the search bar back to where it froze - in order to not miss anything of the video. That just causes YouTube to show a Loading or Buffering animation for a while (presumably the same time it would have taken the video to unfreeze?).

Here's a gist with 3 files:
debug_info_during_hang.txt -> "Copy debug info" taken during the hang
debug_info_after_hang.txt -> "Copy debug info" taken after the hang
about_support.txt -> about:support output

Didn't capture "stats for nerds" yet but when I checked, it didn't seem to show anything different really, will screenshot that next time I encounter it.

https://gist.github.com/Inari-Whitebear/372d4d83b9ba0893417135fcaa34402f
comments.author: inari_whitebear@fastmail.jp

comments.text: Of course I do encounter it again right after posting the comment. So I added the stats-for-nerds to the gist, it isn't from the same exact hang as the "copy debug info", but same video and such. So I hope it'll still be useful
comments.author: inari_whitebear@fastmail.jp

comments.text:
Can you please post the output of about:support.

Are you using an AMD card, 4xx or later?
comments.author: jyavenard@mozilla.com

comments.text:
ok, so you are.
Go to about:config, search for media.wmf.amd.vp9.enabled and set it to false.

Then reload the page. Does it work better?
comments.author: jyavenard@mozilla.com

comments.text:
(In reply to Maire Reavy [:mreavy] Plz needinfo? from comment #3)
> Also: right-click or ctrl-click on the video and select "Stats for Nerds",
> watch it, and if possible take a screenshot during or immediately after a
> pause/stutter.  Attaching the contents of right/ctrl-click Debug Info may
> also be useful.  Thanks

I have captured a number of screen shots with freezing and good playback for reference.  It is only the one youtube channel that I have trouble with.  I captured good and bad playback for reference.  Then later I realized you asked for debug so I added some more with debug info.  Captures titled YT_freeze_08 and YT_freeze_08a are the same video playing with 8a being a later capture.  Then YT_freeze_09 and YT_freeze_10 were captured with additional debug info.

The capture YT_good-playback_11 is good playback of a the video that froze earlier, but this time only played it a in FF window only, not full screen.

I'm finding that if I start the video in a window and do not go full screen, it does not freeze.  However if i go to full screen then back down to window it continues to stutter and freeze.

I don't see a way to attach a zip file with the screen shots to this reply, so I'll look to seen how to add to my bug report.

Lee
comments.author: neon.leon@netzero.com

comments.text:
Adding more info about my issue....
I have captured a number of screen shots with freezing and good playback for reference.  It is only the one youtube channel that I have trouble with.  I captured good and bad playback for reference.  Then later I realized you asked for debug so I added some more with debug info.  Captures titled YT_freeze_08 and YT_freeze_08a are the same video playing with 8a being a later capture.  Then YT_freeze_09 and YT_freeze_10 were captured with additional debug info.

The capture YT_good-playback_11 is good playback of a the video that froze earlier, but this time only played it a in FF window only, not full screen.

I'm finding that if I start the video in a window and do not go full screen, it does not freeze.  However if i go to full screen then back down to window it continues to stutter and freeze.

I'm adding attachment "Youtube playback issues.zip" that has the screen captures of the info.

Lee

summary: Youtube videos freeze in full screen in FF ver 60.0
